questions.text: Which of the following most commonly presents as bilateral proptosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Chloroma

options.label: B
options.text: Pleomorphic adenoma

options.label: C
options.text: Fibrous histiocytoma

options.label: D
options.text: Cavernous hemangioma.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Chloroma Causes of bilateral proptosis are- Developmental anomalies of the skull - craniofacial dysostosis Osteopathies - osteitis deformans, rickets and acromegaly Inflammatory conditions like mikulicz syndrome, late-stage of cavernous sinus thrombosis Endocranial exophthalmos - it may be cytotoxic or thyrotropic.

Highyeild:

The most common cause of bilateral proptosis in children is neuroblastoma and leukemia ( chloroma) and in adults is thyroid ophthalmopathy

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B . Tumors- include symmetrical lymphoma or lymphosarcoma, secondaries from neuroblastoma, nephroblastoma, Ewing's sarcoma, and leukemic infiltration Options: C and D. Systemic diseases like histiocytosis, systemic amyloidosis, xanthomatosis, and Wegener's granulomatosis

questions.text: A well-defined Focal lesion in the cone of extraocular muscles of the eye with proptosis in a child. The diagnosis will be?

options.label: A
options.text: Cavernous Hemangioma

options.label: B
options.text: Hemangioendothelioma

options.label: C
options.text: Capillary angioma

options.label: D
options.text: Retinoblastoma

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hemangioendothelioma Hemangioendothelioma has been described as masses that fall between a hemangioma and angiosarcoma. They are vascular tumors that commonly present with an enlarging mass Most commonly involve the lungs, liver, and musculoskeletal system, although many other body sites have been reported, including the head and neck, intestines, lymph nodes, pleura, retroperitoneum, heel, and stomach.

Highyeild:

Common symptoms include: Discomfort or pain in the abdomen Nausea Cough or trouble breathing Fever Pain and swelling around the tumor area Weight loss Problems moving or walking Skin lumps and bumps that may appear red or blue Broken bones Coughing up blood

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Cavernous hemangioma Option: C. Capillary angioma Option: D. Retinoblastoma

Extraedge:

Investigation- MRI CT

questions.text: The eyelids are mobile tissue curtains placed in front of the eyeballs. Which of the following statements is correct about eyelids?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrous layer causes lagophthalmos in paralysis of the facial nerve

options.label: B
options.text: Submuscular areolar tissue is divided into the central tarsal plate and the peripheral septum orbitale

options.label: C
options.text: Palpebral fascia is a thin membrane of connective tissue attached peripherally to the tarsal plates and centrally to the periosteum

options.label: D
options.text: Layer of non-striated muscle fiber consists of the palpebral muscle of Muller

questions.correct_answer: D. Layer of non-striated muscle fiber consists of the palpebral muscle of Muller
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Layer of non-striated muscle fiber consists of the palpebral muscle of Muller Each eyelid consists (from anterior to posterior) of the following layers: Skin. Subcutaneous areolar tissue Layer of striated muscle Submuscular areolar tissue Fibrous layer Layer of non-striated muscle fibers Conjunctiva

Highyeild:

The layer of non-striated muscle fibers consists of the palpebral muscle of Muller which lies deep to the septum orbitale in both lids. In the upper lid, it arises from the fibers of the LPS muscle, and in the lower lid from the prolongation of the inferior rectus muscle; and is inserted on the peripheral margins of the tarsal plate.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The layer of striated muscle consists of orbicularis muscle which forms an oval sheet across the eyelids. It comprises three portions : the orbital, palpebral (pretarsal and preseptal parts), and lacrimal. It closes the eyelids and is supplied by the zygomatic branch of the facial nerve. Therefore, in paralysis of the facial nerve, there occurs lagophthalmos which may be complicated by exposure keratitis. Option: B. The fibrous layer is the framework of the lids and consists of two parts: the central tarsal plate and the peripheral septum orbitale Option: C. Septum orbitale (palpebral fascia) is a thin membrane of connective tissue attached centrally to the tarsal plates and peripherally to the periosteum of the orbital margin. It is perforated by nerves, vessels, and levator palpebrae superioris (LPS) muscle, which enter the lids from the orbit.

questions.text: Statement 1: Part of the cornea just below the center is more prone to suffer from exposure keratitis Statement 2: During closure of the lids the eyeball goes up.

options.label: A
options.text: Both statements are correct statements and statement 2 is the correct reason for statement 1.

options.label: B
options.text: Both statements are correct but statement 2 is not the correct reason for statement 1.

options.label: C
options.text: Both statements are incorrect

options.label: D
options.text: Statement 1 is correct

questions.correct_answer: A. Both statements are correct statements and statement 2 is the correct reason for statement 1.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Both statements are correct statements and statement 2 is the correct reason for statement 1. During the closure of the lids, the eyeball goes up, which is called the Bell phenomenon . This explains why that part of the cornea just below the center will suffer from degeneration or exposure keratitis.

Highyeild:

In irritations caused by inflammation of the anterior segment of the eye (conjunctivitis, keratitis, scleritis, or anterior uveitis), a reflex spasm of that part of the orbicularis oculi responsible for blinking causes a narrow palpebral fissure on that side.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Both statements are correct but statement 2 is not the correct reason for statement 1. - not the correct option Option: C. Both statements are incorrect - not the correct option Option: D. Statement 1 is correct - not the correct option

Extraedge:

In the primary position of the eyeball , the lower margin of the upper lid just touches the upper limbus, and the upper margin of the lower lid just touches the lower limbus; the size of this palpebral fissure is normally equal on the two sides.

questions.text: The lateral and medial ends of both tarsal plates are connected to the lateral and medial walls of the orbit by the medial and lateral palpebral ligament. Which of the following statements are correct about these ligaments?

options.label: A
options.text: The medial ligament is a triangular structure.

options.label: B
options.text: When the lateral canthus is pulled laterally and upward, the medial palpebral ligament (MPL) forms a well-marked prominence for surface anatomy

options.label: C
options.text: The medial palpebral ligament is attached to Whitnall's tubercle on the zygomatic bone

options.label: D
options.text: The anterior surface of the medial palpebral ligament is free and adherent to the skin

questions.correct_answer: C. The medial palpebral ligament is attached to Whitnall's tubercle on the zygomatic bone
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The medial palpebral ligament is attached to Whitnall's tubercle on the zygomatic bone The lateral palpebral ligament is attached to Whitnall's tubercle on the zygomatic bone, 11 mm below the front of the zygomatic suture. It is 7 x 2.5 mm, lies deeper, and does not form a prominence like the medial palpebral ligament (MPL). Its front surface is fused with the pre-ciliary fibers of the orbicularis .

Highyeild:

The lateral palpebral ligament Its posterior surface is in front of the lateral check ligament and separated from it by a lobule of the lacrimal gland.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The medial palpebral ligament is a somewhat triangular band attached to the frontal process of the maxilla from the anterior lacrimal crest to near its suture with the nasal bone. It has a lower free border, while above it is adherent to and continuous with the periosteum. At the base of the triangle, it divides into anterior and posterior portions. Option: B. When the lateral canthus is pulled laterally and upward, the medial palpebral ligament (MPL) forms a well-marked prominence for surface anatomy. It should be noted that this prominence lies almost entirely in the frontal process of the maxilla. Option: D. The anterior surface of the medial palpebral ligament is free and adherent to the skin. It looks forward and laterally; the two branches look forward and medially and thus make an obtuse angle.

Extraedge:

Medial and lateral palpebral ligaments. Note the lower and of the lacrimal gland touching the hack of the lateral polpebral ligament

questions.text: In the eyelids, submuscular areolar tissue is located below the orbicularis oculi muscle. Which of the following statements about this structure are incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with the dangerous area of the surgeons.

options.label: B
options.text: This space is essentially targeted during infiltration anesthesia.

options.label: C
options.text: It is obliquely traversed by the follicles of the lashes, the glands of Moll, and the meibomian glands

options.label: D
options.text: Levator palpebrae superioris (LPS) divides it into pretarsal and preseptal spaces

questions.correct_answer: C. It is obliquely traversed by the follicles of the lashes, the glands of Moll, and the meibomian glands
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is obliquely traversed by the follicles of the lashes, the glands of Moll, and the meibomian glands The submuscular areolar tissue lies between the orbicularis oculi and the tarsal plate. Submuscular areolar tissue consists of variable, loose connective tissue below the orbicularis oculi muscle. It refers to the subcutaneous palpebral part of the orbicularis oculi.

Highyeild:

The part of the orbicularis oculi that lies next to and occupies the whole thickness of the lid margin is called the muscle of Riolan . It is obliquely traversed by the follicles of the lashes, the glands of Moll, and the meibomian glands.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The submuscular areolar tissue lies between the orbicularis oculi and the tarsal plate and communicates above with the sub aponeurotic stratum of the scalp, the so-called dangerous area of the surgeons. Hence pus or blood can make its way into the upper lid from the dangerous area. It is through this plane, reached by entering the knife at the gray line, that the lid may be split into anterior and posterior portions, the anterior soft portion (skin and muscle layer) and the posterior hard portion; the latter is the tarsal conjunctival layer. Option: B. The main nerves to the lids also lie in this areolar tissue for infiltration anesthesia. The local anesthetic has to be injected deep into the orbicularis. Option: D. In the lower lid , this tissue lies in a single small space, the perceptual space in front of the septum orbitale. In the upper lid, the space in which this tissue lies is divided by the Levator palpebrae superioris (LPS) into pretarsal and perceptual spaces.

questions.text: Correctly identify and label the given structures shown in the given Image: Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1-D, 2-E, 3-A, 4-B, 5-C The fibrous layer gives a shape to the lids. It has a central, very thick, and hard part—the tarsal plates—and a thinner peripheral part called the palpebral fascia or the septum orbitale. There is one tarsal plate for each lid, forming the skeleton of lids and giving them their shape and firmness.

Highyeild:

In the upper lid, the deep division of the tendon of the LPS lies just deep to the septum orbitale and gets attached to the upper border of the upper tarsus and is called the muscle of Müller. In the lower lid, a prolongation of the inferior rectus muscle gets attached to the lower border of the lower tarsus after piercing the lower septum orbitale and this is called the inferior tarsal muscle.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. 1-C, 2-E, 3-A, 4-B, 5-D - not the correct combination. Option: C. 1-E, 2-D, 3-A, 4-B, 5-C - not the correct combination. Option: D . 1-D, 2-E, 3-C, 4-B, 5-A - not the correct combination.

Extraedge:

The Müller muscle and the inferior tarsal muscle are supplied by the cervical sympathetic nerve, which explains ptosis, and drooping of the upper lid in Horner syndrome.

questions.text: Match the given disease processes to the ocular structures they are most likely to involve: Select the correct answer from the given below ciode:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1-b, 2-c, 3-a. Option: A. The sebaceous glands of Zeis are modified sebaceous glands attached directly to the follicles of the eyelashes. Their suppurative inflammation gives rise to a painful yellow nodule at the root of an eyelash called a stye. Option: B. In the upper lid, the deep division of the tendon of the LPS lies just deep to the septum orbitale and gets attached to the upper border of the upper tarsus and is called the muscle of Müller. In the lower lid , a prolongation of the inferior rectus muscle gets attached to the lower border of the lower tarsus after piercing the lower septum orbitale and this is called the inferior tarsal muscle. The Müller muscle and the inferior tarsal muscle are supplied by the cervical sympathetic nerve, which explains ptosis, and drooping of the upper lid in Horner syndrome. Option: C. The weak portions of the septum determine the site of herniation of the orbital fat, which lies just deep into it. These hernias are often seen in the elderly. The septum separates the orbital contents from the lids so that inflammation anterior to the septum does not reach the orbit too quickly. If this occurs orbital inflammation will take longer to present clinically because it may remain restricted there for some time.

Highyeild:

The Müller muscle and the inferior tarsal muscle are supplied by the cervical sympathetic nerve, which explains ptosis, drooping of the upper lid in Horner syndrome

questions.text: The structural framework of eyelids and orbit is secured by various structures such as palpebral ligaments, muscle layer, etc. Which of these statements are incorrect regarding these structures?

options.label: A
options.text: The tarsal plates are responsible for the structural integrity of the lids.

options.label: B
options.text: Superficial lateral canthal tendon can be used as a structure to suspend or stabilize the lateral canthus

options.label: C
options.text: Upon surgical release of the tarsal strap, the medial canthus is elevated easily.

options.label: D
options.text: The caudal orbital septal extension until the levator aponeurosis is important to avoid relapse or complications in ptosis repair and blepharoplasty.

questions.correct_answer: C. Upon surgical release of the tarsal strap, the medial canthus is elevated easily.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Upon surgical release of the tarsal strap, the medial canthus is elevated easily. A lateral tarsal strap , distinct from the lateral canthal tendon, occurs as a broad and strong structure connecting the lower lid tarsal plate to the inferolateral orbital rim. The tarsal strap attaches 3 mm inferiorly and 1 mm deep to the lateral canthal tendon, approximately 4-5 mm deep to the anterior orbital rim. Upon surgical release of the tarsal strap, the lateral canthus is elevated easily.

Highyeild:

The septal extension acts as an adjunct to the levator aponeurosis ; recognition of this structure may be important to avoid relapse or complications in ptosis repair and blepharoplasty.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The tarsal plates are composed of dense fibrous tissue and are responsible for the structural integrity of the lids. Option: B. A small pocket of fat (Eisler pocket) lies between the septum and the lateral canthal tendon . The lateral canthal tendon is also attached to the lateral orbital rim more superficially, through the orbital septum. This superficial fascial plane has been characterized as the “superficial lateral canthal tendon" and may be used as a structure to suspend or stabilize the lateral canthus. Option: C. A septal extension exists from the line of fusion of the orbital septum to the levator aponeurosis, extending caudally to cover the tarsal plate up to the ciliary margin.

questions.text: A patient presents with the following finding to the OPD. Which of the following is/are the cause of exophthalmos?

options.label: A
options.text: High Myopia

options.label: B
options.text: Orbital cellulitis

options.label: C
options.text: Graves disease

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Graves disease Exophthalmos is a term reserved for describing the prominence of the eyes secondary to thyroid disease , while proptosis is used to signify a protrusion of the eyeball due to all other causes. Therefore the correct answer is Graves disease.

Highyeild:

Signs and symptoms of Grave’s disease : Bulging eyes Gritty Sensation pressure or pain in the eyes photosensitivity double vision vision loss

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . High myopia causes pseudo-proptosis. The prominence of the eyeball without any space-occupying lesion in the orbit is called pseudo-proptosis . It is seen in high myopia due to an increase in the size of the eyeball and can also be seen in lid retraction, shallow orbits, and unilateral enophthalmos. Option: B. Orbital cellulitis is a purulent inflammation of the cellular tissue of the orbit. It is most frequently due to the extension of inflammation from the neighboring parts, especially the nasal sinuses. It is a cause of proptosis .

Extraedge:

DIAGNOSIS : If already diagnosed with hyperthyroidism , a doctor may diagnose Grave’s eye disease by examining the eyes and finding swelling and enlargement of the eye muscles. CT Scan or MRI may be useful.

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy presents to the OPD with swelling of the right eyelid which is erythematous. On examination, there is proptosis, gaze restriction, and periorbital edema. Which is the following is true about proptosis?

options.label: A
options.text: preseptal cellulitis present with proptosis and gaze restriction

options.label: B
options.text: Orbital veins varicosity causes pulsatile proptosis

options.label: C
options.text: Lacrimal gland tumors cause axial proptosis

options.label: D
options.text: Shallow orbits are one of the causes of proptosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Lacrimal gland tumors cause axial proptosis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Lacrimal gland tumors cause axial proptosis Lacrimal gland tumors and Superotemporally located dermoid displace the eyeball downwards and inwards causing nonaxial or abaxial proptosis . In nonaxial or abaxial proptosis, the eye is displaced from its central location, opposite the site of the space-occupying lesion.

Highyeild:

In axial proptosis, the eye is pushed anteroposteriorly forwards seen in lesions in the intraconal space , e.g. optic nerve gliomas, meningiomas, and cavernous haemangiomas.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Preseptal cellulitis is a bacterial infection of the eyelid anterior to the orbital septum, and is due to trauma or spread of infection from surrounding structures. Patients complain of acute onset pain and swelling of the lids . On examination, the lid is oedematous with raised temperature and tenderness. Visual acuity and ocular motility are normal and there are no signs of proptosis. Option: B . Varicosity of the orbital veins causes intermittent proptosis . This occurs especially when the head is depressed and is increased by pressure on the corresponding jugular vein or by performing a Valsalva manoeuvre. It can also be caused by intracerebral arteriovenous communication. Option: D. Shallow orbits or exorbitism is a cause of pseudo-proptosis. The prominence of the eyeball without any space-occupying lesion in the orbit is called pseudo-proptosis. It is also seen in high myopia due to an increase in the size of the eyeball, lid retraction, and unilateral enophthalmos.

Extraedge:

The most common benign epithelial lesion in the lacrimal gland is the Pleomorphic Adenoma .

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding proptosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Proptosis is a feature of preseptal cellulitis

options.label: B
options.text: Orbital varices may present as enophthalmos or proptosis

options.label: C
options.text: IgG4 orbitopathy causes proptosis in adults

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

questions.correct_answer: B. Orbital varices may present as enophthalmos or proptosis
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Orbital varices may present as enophthalmos or proptosis Orbital varices can present as enophthalmos but on the Valsalva manoeuvre, proptosis can be appreciated. This is known as intermittent proptosis which occurs especially when the head is depressed, enophthalmos being present in the erect position.

Highyeild:

Orbital Varices are increased by pressure on the corresponding jugular vein or by performing a Valsalva manoeuvre . It can also be caused by intracerebral arteriovenous communication .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Preseptal cellulitis commonly presents as a swelling of the lids, erythema, and chemosis often conjunctival discharge but no proptosis or restriction of ocular movements or visual function. Proptosis is seen in orbital cellulitis. Option: C . IgG4 orbitopathy causes enophthalmos because fibrosis is a major component of the disease.

Extraedge:

Orbital Varices on USG An intermittently anechoic retrobulbar lesion that exhibits intrinsic flow during the Valsalva maneuver is indicative of varix. Color Doppler imaging may demonstrate a reversal of flow toward the transducer during the Valsalva.
